content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
Under the Freedom of Information Act I would like to request the following information:
• The revenue that has been raised from your clean air zone (including fares and charges) since it began operating til the end of 2023
• Since the zone began operating til the end of 2023, the amount of money spent by the authority that was raised via the clean air zone and what services that money has been spent on
• 5 locations in your local authority that have seen the highest reductions in air pollution since the clean air zone began operating til the end of 2023, and the measured reductions in pollutants
Please provide such data electronically. If possible, please provide it as a spreadsheet. If that is not possible, please provide it in a table if you can.
Regards,
Tim Dodd

Dear Jonathan Fagg,
Thank you for your request for information relating to CAZ  which we
received on 29/02/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 28/03/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail
References
Visible links
1. mailto:[Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear FOI,
I have had no response to this yet the deadline was 2 April. Please can this be urgently expedited?
Yours sincerely,
BBC England Data Unit

Dear Tim Dodd
Thank you for your email today, and we sincerely apologise for missing the
deadline to your request and failing to follow-up.
There were three components of your request and we are providing two now
and the third by the close of play tomorrow.
Request: The revenue that has been raised from your clean air zone
(including fares and charges) since it began operating til the end of 2023
Response: £2,188,410.00
Request: 5 locations in your local authority that have seen the highest
reductions in air pollution since the clean air zone began operating til
the end of 2023, and the measured reductions in pollutants
Response: Top 5 reductions by concentration change between 2022 and 2023;
1. Tube 179 Spital Hill (2023 - 24.5ug/m3 vs 2022 – 61.0ug/m3) –
37.3ug/m3  reduction
2. Tube 183 Herries Rd / Barnsley Rd (2023 – 48.2ug/m3 vs 2022 –
64.2ug/m3) – 20.8ug/m3 reduction
3. Tube 176 Station Taxi Rank (2023 – 54.3ug/m3 vs 2022 – 76.8ug/m3) –
20.2ug/m3 reduction
4. Tube 19 Fitzalan Sq (2023 – 65.5ug/m3 vs 2022 - 74.8ug/m3) – 18.9ug/m3
reduction
5. Tube 180 Owler Ln / Firth Park Rd (2023 – 39.5ug/m3 vs 2022 –
49.7ug/m3) – 18.9ug/m3 reduction
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author

3. mailto:[Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear FOI,
You did not provide the third element of the request by the close of play 17th April as promised. Should I now refer to ICO? Please respond by COP today.
Yours sincerely,
BBC England Data Unit

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Clean air zone FOI'.
You did not provide the third element of the request by the close of play 17th April as promised.
Yours faithfully,
BBC England Data Unit

Dear FOI,
Please can I get an acknowledgement of the above
Yours sincerely,
BBC England Data Unit

Dear Tim Dodd,
Thank you for your request for an internal review dated 29 April 2024 of
the handling of your request. We are sorry for our delay in answering the
third aspect of your request, which you first made on 29 February 2024,
and we provided two elements for on 16 April 2024 (when the legal deadline
was 28 March 2024.) We acknowledge your chasing emails of 17 April 2024, 2
May 2024, 3 May, and 7 May 2024.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
Our response is due on 29 May 2024, although we will try to get it to you
sooner.
If you have any queries in the meantime, please contact us at the email
address below.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may

Dear FOI,
Just checking in that I will receive a response to this today or tomorrow on 29 May
Yours sincerely,
BBC England Data Unit

Dear FOI you have missed the deadline
Please can you confirm you'll be sending this today?
Yours sincerely,
BBC England Data Unit
